DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim study analyse long-term effectiveness interprofessional interdisciplinary rehabilitation program name `` PASTOR '' , biopsychosocial approach participant chronic non-specific low back pain ( CLBP ) compare standard inpatient multidisciplinary orthopaedic rehabilitation ( MOR ) Germany . The investigator hypothesize adult CLBP rehabilitation program PASTOR would result significantly high increase functional ability 12 month completion program comparison standard inpatient MOR . The investigator hypothesize PASTOR would lead significantly large improvement regard pain-related cognition , pain cop strategy , physical activity , health-related quality life , back pain episode compare standard inpatient MOR .
DOC.brief_title: Interprofessional Rehabilitation Adults With Chronic Non-specific Low Back Pain
